articles.headline: E.C.B. Under Pressure to Ride to the Euro's Rescue
articles.snippet: Based on economic and market indicators, and a growing sense of public panic, top European Central Bank officials could easily justify a policy move at their regular monthly meeting Wednesday.
articles.abstract: Based on economic and market indicators, and a growing sense of public panic, top European Central Bank officials could easily justify a policy move at their regular monthly meeting Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The European Central Bank must decide Wednesday whether to stand on principle and insist that political leaders take their turn at dealing with the euro zone’s banking and debt crisis, or bend to market forces and once again ride to the rescue.

articles.headline: Solar Panel Payments Set Off a Fairness Debate
articles.snippet: An incentive to get customers to use renewable energy systems is now seen as overly generous in some circles, as it may raise rates for other customers.
articles.abstract: An incentive to get customers to use renewable energy systems is now seen as overly generous in some circles, as it may raise rates for other customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: In California’s sun-scorched Central Valley, the monthly electric bill can easily top $200. But that’s just about what George Burman spent on electricity for all of last year.

articles.headline: Europe’s Fade Becomes Drag on Sales for U.S. Companies
articles.snippet: After weathering the first two years of Europe’s economic crisis fairly well, some companies in the United States are warning investors that their sales on the Continent are slowing down.
articles.abstract: After weathering the first two years of Europe’s economic crisis fairly well, some companies in the United States are warning investors that their sales on the Continent are slowing down.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the European crisis intensifies, a growing number of companies in the United States are warning investors that sales in the region are slowing and could get much worse.

articles.headline: Germany Is Open to Pooling Debt, With Conditions
articles.snippet: German leaders have not provided details of a potential deal, but it would likely mean an expansion of executive power in Brussels over fiscal targets in member states.
articles.abstract: German leaders have not provided details of a potential deal, but it would likely mean an expansion of executive power in Brussels over fiscal targets in member states.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Pressed by a banking crisis and turmoil in the markets, Germany has indicated that it is prepared to accept a grand bargain that would provide greater support for its most indebted euro zone partners in exchange for more centralized control over government spending in Europe.

articles.headline: Elite Military Forces Are Denied in Bid for Expansion
articles.snippet: Congress and the State Department rejected a request from the leader of Special Operations Command for new authority to train foreign security forces.
articles.abstract: Congress and the State Department rejected a request from the leader of Special Operations Command for new authority to train foreign security forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In late April, the military’s Special Operations Command presented the State Department and Congress with an urgent request for new authority to train and equip security forces in places like Yemen and Kenya.

articles.headline: Promoting Nutrition, Disney to Restrict Junk-Food Ads
articles.snippet: Some current advertisers would not meet the new standards announced by the entertainment giant on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: Some current advertisers would not meet the new standards announced by the entertainment giant on Tuesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Walt Disney Company, in an effort to address concerns about entertainment’s role in childhood obesity, announced on Tuesday that all products advertised on its child-focused television channels, radio stations and Web sites must comply with a strict new set of nutritional standards.

articles.headline: Walker Survives Wisconsin Recall Vote
articles.snippet: The victory by Gov. Scott Walker ensures that Republicans largely retain control of Wisconsin, and Mr. Walker’s fast-rising political profile is likely to soar among conservatives.
articles.abstract: The victory by Gov. Scott Walker ensures that Republicans largely retain control of Wisconsin, and Mr. Walker’s fast-rising political profile is likely to soar among conservatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: WAUKESHA, Wis. — Gov. Scott Walker, whose decision to cut collective bargaining rights for most public workers set off a firestorm in a state usually known for its political civility, easily held on to his job on Tuesday, becoming the first governor in the country to survive a recall election and dealing a painful blow to Democrats and labor unions.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey and Jeff Zeleny
